1.text: Purchase 4 live lobsters from your local grocery store.

2.text: Fill a 6 gallons (23 L) stockpot with 4 to 5 gallons (15 to 19 L) of water.

3.text: Add 12 tablespoons of salt per 1 gallon (3.8 L) of water.

4.text: Add 1 sprig of thyme, 2 bay leaves, and the juice of 1 lemon into the water.

5.text: Bring the water to a full rolling boil.

6.text: Hold the lobsters by the tail with your tongs and put them in the water.

7.text: Boil 8 minutes for each 1 pound (0.45 kg) of lobster.

8.text: Check whether the lobsters are cooked after the allotted cooking time.

9.text: Drain your lobsters in a colander.

10.text: Remove the tips of each lobster claw.

11.text: Melt 2⁄3 cup (160 ml) melted butter in a heavy saucepan on your stovetop.

12.text: Serve your lobster with your choice of sides.
